Welcome to PhotoShare’s documentation!¶

REST API repository Comments¶

async src.repository.comments.create_comment(comment: CommentCreate, photo_id: int, user_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The create_comment function creates a comment for a photo.
Args:

comment (schemas_comments.CommentCreate): The CommentCreate schema object that contains the description of the new comment to be created. photo_id (int): The id of the photo that is being commented on. user_id (int): The id of the user who is creating this new comment.&lt;/code&gt;

Parameters:

  • comment – schemas_comments.CommentCreate: Create a new comment

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo id from the url

  • user_id – int: Get the user_id of the user who created the comment

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Check if the user is authenticated

Returns:

The db_comment object

async src.repository.comments.delete_comment(comment_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The delete_comment function deletes a comment from the database.
Args:

comment_id (int): The id of the comment to be deleted. db (AsyncSession): An async session object for interacting with the database. user (User): A User object representing who is making this request.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Find the comment in the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

Returns:

A comment object

async src.repository.comments.get_comments(photo_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_comments function takes in a photo_id and returns all comments associated with that photo.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the comments for a specific photo

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Get the user’s id, which is used to check if they have liked a comment or not

Returns:

A list of comments, so the following function should be used instead:

async src.repository.comments.update_comment(comment_id: int, comment: CommentUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The update_comment function updates a comment in the database.
Args:

comment_id (int): The id of the comment to be updated. comment (schemas_comments.CommentUpdateSchema): The new description for the specified Comment object. db (AsyncSession): An async session with an open connection to a PostgreSQL database server, as defined in main(). user (User): A User object containing information about who is making this request, as defined by FastAPI’s @get_current_user() decorator and passed into this function by its parent function update().

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Identify the comment that is being updated

  • comment – schemas_comments.CommentUpdateSchema: Get the comment from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Check if the user is the owner of the comment

Returns:

A comment object, which is a sqlalchemy model

REST API repository Photos¶

async src.repository.photos.apply_filter_and_text(url: str, filter_name: str, text: str, font_family: str, font_size: int, font_color: str, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The apply_filter_and_text function applies a filter and text to the photo with the given url.
Args:

url (str): The URL of the photo to be edited. filter_name (str): The name of the filter to apply. text (str): The text that will be added on top of the image. font_family (str): Font family for adding text on top of an image, e.g., &quot;Arial&quot;.

See https://cloudinary-res.cloudinary.com/image/upload/fl_layer_apply,l_text

Filter Names for Image Processing in Cloudinary and Their Functions:

  • grayscale: Converts the image to grayscale.

  • sepia: Adds a vintage effect to the image.

  • blackwhite: Converts the image to high-contrast black and white.

  • saturation: Controls the color saturation in the image.

  • brightness: Adjusts the brightness of the image.

  • contrast: Controls the contrast between colors in the image.

  • blur: Blurs the image, creating a blur effect.

  • sharpen: Increases the sharpness of the image.

  • hue: Changes the color tone in the image.

  • invert: Inverts the colors in the image.

Parameters:

  • url – str: Get the url of the photo

  • filter_name – str: Specify the name of the filter to be applied

  • text – str: Pass the text that will be written on the photo

  • font_family – str: Set the font family of the text

  • font_size – int: Set the font size of the text

  • font_color – str: Set the color of the text

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a database session for the function

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

A dictionary with the edited_url key

async src.repository.photos.attach_tag_to_photo(photo_id: int, tag_name: str, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The attach_tag_to_photo function attaches a tag to a photo.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Specify the photo to which we want to attach a tag

  • tag_name – str: Specify the name of the tag to be attached

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is an admin or not

Returns:

A tag

async src.repository.photos.convert_photo_format(url: str, new_format: str, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The convert_photo_format function converts the format of a photo to a new one.
Args:

url (str): The URL of the photo to be converted. new_format (str): The desired format for the converted photo.

Returns:

dict: A dictionary containing information about the transformed image, including its URL and transformation details.

Parameters:

  • url – str: Specify the url of the photo that needs to be converted

  • new_format – str: Specify the format of the converted photo

  • db – AsyncSession: Get access to the database

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

A dictionary with the converted_url key

async src.repository.photos.create_tag(tag_name: str, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The create_tag function creates a new tag in the database.
Args:

tag_name (str): The name of the new tag to be created. db (AsyncSession): An async session object for interacting with the database. user (User): A User object representing who is creating this new tag.

Returns:

PhotoTags: The newly created PhotoTags object, or None if it already exists.

Parameters:

  • tag_name – str: Pass the tag name to the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user has admin rights

Returns:

None if the tag does not exist

async src.repository.photos.crop_photo(url: str, width: int, height: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The crop_photo function crops a photo to the specified width and height.
Args:

url (str): The URL of the photo to be cropped. width (int): The desired width of the cropped image in pixels. height (int): The desired height of the cropped image in pixels.

Returns:
A JSON object containing a single key, &quot;cropped_url&quot;, whose value is

a string representing the URL for accessing this newly-cropped image.

Parameters:

  • url – str: Get the url of the photo that needs to be cropped

  • width – int: Set the width of the cropped photo

  • height – int: Set the height of the cropped image

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Check if the user has access to the photo

Returns:

The cropped_url, but the function is not called in the code

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.photos.delete_photo(photo_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → None¶
The delete_photo function deletes a photo from the database.
Args:

photo_id (int): The id of the photo to delete. db (AsyncSession): An async session for interacting with the database. user (User): The user making this request, used to check permissions.

Raises:

HTTPException(403) if the requesting user is not an admin and does not own this resource.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Specify the photo to delete

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Check if the user has permission to delete the photo

Returns:

None, which is not a valid response type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.photos.generate_qr_code(transformed_photo_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The generate_qr_code function generates a QR code for the transformed photo.

The function takes in the transformed_photo_id and returns a dictionary with qr_code url as key and path to the generated QR code as value.

Parameters:

  • transformed_photo_id – int: Get the transformed photo from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user has access to the transformed image

Returns:

A dictionary with the key qr_code_url

async src.repository.photos.generate_transformed_photo_link(transformed_photo_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The generate_transformed_photo_link function is used to generate a link to the transformed photo.

The function takes in the transformed_photo_id and returns a url for that particular photo.

Parameters:

  • transformed_photo_id – int: Get the transformed photo from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user id of the currently logged in user

Returns:

A dictionary with the transformed photo url

  • db – AsyncSession: Connect to the database

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

async src.repository.photos.get_tags_for_photo(photo_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

async src.repository.photos.resize_photo(url: str, width: int, height: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The resize_photo function takes a url, width and height as parameters. It then uploads the photo to cloudinary with the given dimensions. The resized_url is returned in a dictionary.

Parameters:

  • url – str: Pass the url of the photo to be resized

  • width – int: Set the width of the photo

  • height – int: Set the height of the photo

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to perform this action

Returns:

A dictionary with the resized_url key

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.photos.update_photo(photo_id: int, body: PhotoUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → Photos¶
The update_photo function updates a photo in the database.
Args:

photo_id (int): The id of the photo to update. body (PhotoUpdateSchema): The schema containing the new values for this Photo. db (AsyncSession): A database session object, used to query and commit changes to the database.

Returns:

Photos: An updated version of this Photo.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo by id

  • body – PhotoUpdateSchema: Get the description from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Connect to the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is an admin or not

Returns:

A photo object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.photos.upload_photo(file_path: str, user_id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶
The upload_photo function uploads a photo to the cloudinary server and returns a Photo object.
Args:

file_path (str): The path of the image file to be uploaded. user_id (int): The id of the user who is uploading this photo.

Parameters:

  • file_path – str: Specify the path of the file to be uploaded

  • user_id – int: Identify the user who uploaded the photo

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A photo object

async src.repository.users.update_user_role(email: str, new_role: str, db: AsyncSession) → User¶
The update_user_role function updates the role of a user in the database.
Args:

email (str): The email address of the user to update. new_role (str): The new role for this user. db (AsyncSession): An async session object from SQLAlchemy’s Asyncio engine, which is used to interact with our database.

Returns:

User: A User object representing the updated record in our database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to update

  • new_role – str: Set the new role of the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

The updated user object
